4.  I can `reroll_shop` - Rerolling is low risk for a high reward, and I can afford it.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

Okay, here's the breakdown of my thinking in this shop. I've got $63, and the ante is at 5. My primary goal is to optimize my Flush strategy, and I have a decent set-up already: Gros Michel (+15 Mult, with a 1/6 chance to break), Egg ($31 sell value), Droll Joker (+10 Mult for Flush, x1.5 Mult Polychrome), Perkeo (Legendary, copies 1 consumable at the end of the shop, +1 slot), and Blue Joker (+92 chips). I also have "The Moon" consumable, which converts 3 cards to Clubs, vital for my Flush gameplan.

The key here is Perkeo. I need "The Moon" to be the *only* consumable I have at the end of this shop so I can guarantee its duplication. This will give me a very reliable Club-focused deck.

Looking at the shop, Loyalty Card ($4) is tempting (X4 Mult every 6 hands), but to take it, I'd have to sell a Joker (either Gros Michel or Blue Joker). Gros Michel is risky, and Loyalty Card is inconsistent. Pluto ($2) levels up High Card. The Star ($2) converts cards to Diamonds, which would destroy my suit focus.

I've decided on an action that won't disrupt my Perkeo strategy: `buy_and_use_consumable 2`, which is Pluto. It's cheap, gives a small benefit to my base hand, and importantly, doesn't mess with my consumable inventory.

I should *not* buy "The Star" because it requires targeting cards, and the command description says I can't do this if it requires targeting cards.

I have enough money, and I have a Reroll Surplus voucher. I could reroll the shop, but Pluto is a guaranteed small benefit, so I'll grab it.

I've considered Loyalty Card, but Gros Michel is more consistent for my current playstyle. So, the plan is to buy Pluto. I'm going with `buy_and_use_consumable` at position 2 (Pluto).
